column4: I am trying to find the location of a executable, how do I find it dpkg -l <name> lists a file directory but what if I want to find the location of a file inside
I am trying to find the location of a executable, how do I find it dpkg -l <name> lists a file directory but what if I want to find the location of a file inside
a file call adb, its from android sdk
I am having problems connecting to my phone via usb, and on way was try it in SU mode, and when I log into SU and type adb it doesnt work, but if I am not in SU, it works
I am a nub so sorry if I seem daft
the command would be "which adb" i see im late in giving that answer
which is what I wanted ty!
: When I logged into SU, and went to the folder where adb was located it didnt do anything, and suggestions on why this happened?
its failing because when you login as root "sudo -i" you change the working directory to /root but you installed adb to /home/username/whatever so you need to cd /home/username/whatever
so I need to type sudo -i su ?
you shouldnt be using "su" on ubuntu at all
either sudo adb whatever or sudo -i; adb whatever
then this guide is probably not what I want to use then, thank you
im sure the guide is fine except that we use sudo not su
if you see "su" in isolation replace it with "sudo -i" if you see "su -c command" replace it with "sudo command"
